thread.title: It's brother vs. brothers in a special day of soccer for Benzer family
thread.title_full: It's brother vs. brothers in a special day of soccer for Benzer family

author: Glenn Graham
title: It's brother vs. brothers in a special day of soccer for Benzer family
text:
It's brother vs. brothers in a special day of soccer for Benzer family Soccer Glenn Graham The Baltimore Sun Wednesday's Poly at Friends boys soccer game a special one for the Benzer family. 
All the banter in the Benzer household is complete, the friendly side wager has been made. 
On Wednesday afternoon at 4, Poly senior Simon Benzer will play his last regular-season soccer game, playing at Friends, and he'll be up against his sophomore twin brothers, Paul and Jack. Simon plays forward for Poly, while Jack is a defender and Paul plays up front for Friends. 
The brothers' parents -- Eric and Sandi -- will find seats right smack in the middle of the stands to show their loyalties to both sides. Eric will be sporting a Poly shirt and Friends hat. 
"The boys are really best friends," Eric said. "They've played sports their whole life together -- soccer, baseball and lacrosse. It's just unbelievable that the schedule played out this way." 
At 13-3, Friends is enjoying a solid season in the Maryland Interscholastic Athletic Association B Conference. And while Poly has struggled through a 2-6-1 campaign and will be the clear underdog on Wednesday, it didn't stop Simon from talking some smack. 
"Simon has been growing a little beard lately and he and Jack have a little wager that if Friends win, Simon needs to shave it off. Simon I believe will be shaving at the end of the day," Eric said.
